metadata.title: CVE-2019-15538 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in xfs_setattr_nonsize in fs/xfs/xfs_iops.c in theLinux kernel through 5.2.9. XFS partially wedges when a chgrp fails onaccount of being out of disk quota. xfs_setattr_nonsize is failing tounlock the ILOCK after the xfs_qm_vop_chown_reserve call fails. This isprimarily a local DoS attack vector, but it might result as well in remoteDoS if the XFS filesystem is exported for instance via NFS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15538` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-65-generic - 4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-65-lowlatency - 4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1007-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1046.49').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1026.29~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
